summary: The plumber parked his van in front of the apartment house and took his tools out of the back. He walked into the lobby and took the elevator to the twelfth floor, where he felt uncomfortable suspecting his neighbors of dishonesty. Recent events had led him to this suspicion, including the disappearance of a necklace and a collection of coins. The plumber, Paul, was trying to understand what was going on in the apartment house. He had noticed some suspicious behavior from his neighbors, including Ms. Franklin and Mr. Carson.
quotes: there was something going on that he didn't understand
he felt really uncomfortable ab about about
